titles.title: Low-Income Housing Preservation Act of 1997
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax incentives to encourage the preservation of low-income housing.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 3/18/1997--Introduced. Low-Income Housing Preservation Act of 1997 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide a 15-year recovery period for the depreciation deduction for new investments to rehabilitate qualified low-income housing projects. Exempts $50,000 ($25,000 in the case of a separate return by a married individual) of such rehabilitation costs from the passive loss limitations. Provides a special rule for computing the depreciation deduction for such housing projects.
